citations.narrative:
The facility is housing approximately 85 rabbits (70 bucks and 15 does) in enclosures that do not provide adequate space.
The facility has approval for use of innovative primary enclosures that do not precisely meet the space requirements in the
AWA regulations for rabbits weighing less than 11.9lbs. Approximately 85 rabbits that weighed more than 11.9lbs (14-
16.5lbs) are being housed in these innovative enclosures. Adequate space is important for rabbits to support normal
behavior and postural adjustments. Administrator approval for use of innovative enclosures is granted only after careful
review and consideration of the impacts on animal welfare and specific parameters (body weight) are included in this
approval. USDA has not approved the use of these innovative enclosures for rabbits that exceed 11.9lbs. Correct by
ensuring all parameters of the approval for innovative enclosures are met or by housing rabbits in primary enclosures that
meet the space requirements in 3.53(c)(2) by 9/10/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
